page.title: 09RELIGIOUS BUILDINGS
page.content: Walsall is a multi-faith community with many religious buildings, including Mandirs, Sikh temple, Churches and Mosques. There has always been a Church above Walsall on a limestone hill since about 1200, now called St. Matthew's and a new mosque centre is being built with separate ladies and men's rooms, washrooms and toilets. The name of it is Aryum-En-Ishate-Islam. In our Junior School we did a survey of how many of our children go to each different place of worship. The results were: 100 Sikhs go to the temple; 52 Muslims go to the mosque; 31 Hindus go to the Mandir; 17 Anglicans and 11 Methodists go to the church; 4 others go to a place of worship. In Walsall there is also an inter-faith group which meets every month to discuss different issues.
